titles.title: ABM Treaty Interpretation Resolution
ABM Treaty Interpretation Resolution

A resolution concerning constitutional principles pertinent to the making of treaties, and further concerning the interpretation of the Treaty Between the United States of America and the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics on the Limitation of Anti-Ballistic Missile Systems.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported to Senate by Senator Biden with an amendment. With written report No. 100-164. Additional views filed.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 321.

term.name: Advice and consent of the Senate

bill.summary: 9/22/1987--Reported to Senate amended. (Reported to Senate from the Committee on Foreign Relations with amendment, S. Rept. 100-164) ABM Treaty Interpretation Resolution - Declares the policy of the Senate with respect to the Constitution and as it applies in interpreting the Anti-Ballistic Missile (ABM) Treaty between the United States and the Soviet Union. States that the development, testing, or deployment of specified ABM systems is inconsistent with the Treaty and therefore requires an amendment to be agreed to by both countries and approved by the Senate.
